1774.title: Multi-Tenancy: Signal Events
1774.body:
For more information and best practices, please¬†visit confluence.
Value Proposition Statement üöÄ
Use Signal Events with a cluster that has Multi-Tenancy activated.
User Problem ü§¶


Signal Events cannot be used with Multi-Tenancy currently, but Signal Events were introduced with Camunda 8.3.


This means users who have Multi-Tenancy activated and using it are required to find a replacement for Signal Events.


User Stories üßë‚ÄçüöÄ
As a Developer, I can deploy processes with Signal Events to a tenant. 
As a Developer, I can trigger signals via API.
Implementation üë∑
Implementation Notes
BroadcastSignal RPC: For a multi-tenant user, an explicit tenant id is required. A signal can‚Äôt be broadcast, as it must define on which tenant it will start process instances or be caught in existing ones.

comments: Link to feature: https://camunda.productboard.com/feature-board/planning/features/23809923

Breakdown
This section links to various sub-issues / -tasks contributing to respective epic phase or phase results where appropriate.

Breakdown doc
camunda/zeebe#13336

Discovery phase
Example: link to "Conduct customer interview with xyz"
Define phase


Consider: UI, UX, technical design, documentation design


Ask yourself: how is this going to be supported? Can we do something to enable the Support team to deal with support tickets without reaching out to e.g., the engineering team?


Example: link to "Define User-Journey Flow" or "Define target architecture"


Design Planning


`Reviewed by design: Oct 2023


`Designer assigned: No design needed


Documentation Planning


Complex changes must be reviewed during the Define phase by the DRI of Documentation or technical writer.


Briefly describe the anticipated impact to documentation


Example: "Creates structural changes in docs as UX is reworked." Add docs reviewer to Epic for feedback.


Risk Management


Assessment: Link to the risk assessment in one trust.


Risk Class: Add the risk class of the identified risk. If multiple risks have been identified enter the highest identified risk class.


Implement phase
Example: link to "Implement User Story xyz". Should not only include core implementation, but also documentation.
Validation Criteria
Criteria indicating success, for example metrics collected using telemetry. To be used during Validation phase to evaluate the success of the overall Epic.
Validate phase
Example: link to "Evaluate usage data of last quarter"
Link to additional collateral

@abbasadel I created this epic to make work on Signal Events for MT transparent. As agreed we have this now as 8.4 target. I believe I can move it to Define already as we discussed topic already. let me know if there is anything else required
@felix-mueller - Do you think this feature will require design involvement?

@felix-mueller - Do you think this feature will require design involvement?

@melanie-butcher - No, I changed label to no
@koevskinikola could you perhaps help and add the zeebe breakdown for signal event for Multi-Tenancy to this epic?

@felix-mueller I've included the Zeebe issue in this issue's description. The task breakdown is already defined there.
The ZPA team multi-tenancy breakdown document (including Signals) can be found here,. Should we reference it in this issue?
I see dx tagged as a component team here. Is this due to the API changes?

I see dx tagged as a component team here. Is this due to the API changes?

@akeller - correct this was the idea. is there a better component to tag for these kind of changes?

@felix-mueller nope! This works great. You are the first to use it üòé so I'll set expectations with my team.
@jwulf @1nb0und, FYI on this topic. This will have API changes, which will need to be handled by the SDKs. Please create an issue for tracking your work to support this epic.

@felix-mueller as I started the implementation of multi-tenancy for signal broadcasting in Zeebe, I moved this issue to Implement. We already defined what we want to add in signals with the previous dev iteration.
Is Desktop Modeler involved in this epic? This would help us prioritize @jwulf's work for updating Node Zeebe.

Is Desktop Modeler involved in this epic? This would help us prioritize @jwulf's work for updating Node Zeebe.

@akeller - no, this is independent from Desktop Modeler
To quote Nikola: Signal broadcasting and resource deletion are in Zeebe 8.4.0-alpha1 . Hence I am also tagging this for alpha1

Sorry for the confusion everyone - my mistake.
While we deliver this internally with alpha1 (Zeebe scope), we yet need to have full integration testing prior to delivering this externally. Since the labels shall indicate the external delivery scope, I am marking this for alpha2 again.

@johanwelgemoed @marcosgvieira @RomanJRW - I added labels for webapps here as I heard we are still missing tasks for QA on each component. can you link issues if this is true? if you believe nothing is needed, feel free to remove the label.
@akeller docs were added from the Zeebe side with camunda/camunda-docs#2820. AFAIK no other documentation is needed.
Thanks @felix-mueller. I have removed Optimize from this - we have test coverage sufficient for this scenario üëç
A summary on the remaining TO-DOs for MT can be found here.
@felix-mueller can we move this to validate?

@koevskinikola can you help here? I asked Abbas here this morning: https://camunda.slack.com/archives/C060P7JCNEP/p1702546160649049
but I think he is out

As far as I can tell docs are adjusted
Feature is ready in Zeebe
But other teams (Operate and Tasklist wanted to have tests)?
Hi @felix-mueller , I added my updates yesterday here
Marking as version:8.4-alpha1 where this feature was delivered. This epic is still open, since e2e integration tests are not concluded yet. See #1774 (comment)
Assigning @abbasadel because he is coordinating the finalization of this epic (e.g., ensuring that e2e tests are followed up on)
Update from ELT: @mschoe is doing final e2e testing today. If successful, will move to validate.
@mschoe was this successful?

tasks.title: Zeebe supports multi-tenancy for BPMN signal events

tasksInRelease.title: Zeebe supports multi-tenancy for BPMN signal events

12653.title: [EPIC] Zeebe multi-tenancy support
12653.body:
Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
Enable Zeebe to support the concept of multiple tenants. Tenant data is clearly separated per tenant while reusing a single Zeebe cluster.
Task breakdown
The goal of the first phase is to provide core multi-tenancy concepts/mechanisms in the Zeebe Broker and Gateway. These concepts will later be used as building blocks to support multi-tenancy in Zeebe.

The goal of phase 2 is to provide multi-tenancy support for core Zeebe concepts like process instances and jobs. The intention is to provide multi-tenancy support for these concepts early in the implementation so that other Camunda Platform 8 components are unblocked, and can start implementing multi-tenancy on their side as well.
Each task of phase 2 covers the vertical implementation (engine, gateway, client, data migration, documentation) for a Zeebe concept. The vertical implementation of the deployments functionality can serve as an example.

comments: @koevskinikola Fyi I put supporting resource deletion in Phase 3. I didn't fully write it out yet, but I think it's important to list it so we don't forget.

@koevskinikola For keeping track of incurred tech debt:

#14256
Issues related to tech debt incurred by the multi-tenancy implementation have been moved to #15710.
Closing this issue as the multi-tenancy epic is completed in Zeebe.

13237.title: Support multi-tenancy in the Gateway
13237.body:
Description
For multi-tenancy, the goal of the Zeebe Gateway is to:

Provide data on the user's authorized tenants.
Forward this data (through the RecordMetadata) to the Zeebe Broker through a Broker*Request instance.

Full support for multi-tenancy in the Zeebe gateway will be provided once camunda-cloud/identity#1819 is completed.
For this issue, the Zeebe Gateway should (only) support the following:

Provide a Gateway configuration flag: zeebe.gateway.multiTenancy.enabled - default FALSE (disabled)

The flag should toggle multi-tenancy for the Zeebe cluster.
An enabled flag is preferred, as we will probably add additional multi-tenancy configuration properties in the future.


Expand the IdentityInterceptor class. After the token is successfully verified the following should be performed:

Provide a list of tenant ids the user has access to:

If multi-tenancy is disabled, the list should only contain the <default> tenant id (see #13235)
If multi-tenancy is enabled, the Identity SDK should be used to fetch the list of tenant ids (out-of-scope for this issue)


[Proposal] Place the list of tenant IDs in a gRPC context to be forwarded to the EndpointManager/RequestMapper (consider doing it through a helper class).


We should provide a general (auth) API that the IdentityInterceptor class will implement. The goal is to provide an Identity-independent use of multi-tenancy, i.e. users can use a multi-tenant Zeebe without the need of Camunda Identity.

comments:
@koevskinikola & @korthout,


[...] After the token is successfully verified the following should be performed:

Provide a list of tenant ids the user has access to:

If multi-tenancy is disabled, the list should only contain the  tenant id (see #13235)






Does that mean, that if tenancy is disabled, it will still ask Identity to provide a list of tenants?
And another question: What happens if tenancy is disabled and Identity is not configured (i.e., Zeebe is used "standalone")? Does the Gateway still provide the default tenant to include it in the respective broker requests?

if tenancy is disabled, it will still ask Identity to provide a list of tenants?

I don't think so, because that's the behavior when multi-tenancy is enabled.

If multi-tenancy is enabled, the Identity SDK should be used to fetch the list of tenant ids

Apart from the description, I would also find it very odd if Identity is still asked.


What happens if tenancy is disabled and Identity is not configured (i.e., Zeebe is used "standalone")? Does the Gateway still provide the default tenant to include it in the respective broker requests?

I would assume that the default tenant would be added to the tenant access ids list, so it can be used in the broker requests where the default tenant is assumed when multi-tenancy is disabled. This means data isolation can be guaranteed.
I moved #14285 out of scope and will link it to a different issue.
@abbasadel I've marked #14286 as closing this issue. I think that's fine for Zeebe, as #14307 is Helm Charts related and not blocking Zeebe.
Make sense. Thanks @korthout

Support general-usage tenant-providing interceptor for SM
Cache authorization for token in gateway
